column4: I'm trying to close up my customized liveCD so I can see how big it is before I go any further. But I can't do "sudo umount edit/dev". It tells me that the "device is busy." What do I do?
I'm trying to close up my customized liveCD so I can see how big it is before I go any further. But I can't do "sudo umount edit/dev". It tells me that the "device is busy." What do I do?
I'm trying to close up my customized liveCD so I can see how big it is before I go any further. But I can't do "sudo umount edit/dev". It tells me that the "device is busy." What do I do?
I'm trying to close up my customized liveCD so I can see how big it is before I go any further. But I can't do "sudo umount edit/dev". It tells me that the "device is busy." What do I do?
I'm not a bot. But I am severely annoyed.
And it's the same time I come in here too.
Each and every time, I come in here with a problem. I try to be patient and wait. I even help others while I wait! But no matter what, I am ignored, all the time! I'm sick of it!
I understand you're all volunteers and you don't HAVE to help me. But I've been in here like, 15 times with the same result each time.
I'm trying to close up my customized liveCD so I can see how big it is before I go any further. But I can't do "sudo umount edit/dev". It tells me that the "device is busy." What do I do?
I'm using the guide at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LiveCDCustomization, and I mounted edit/dev with sudo mount --bind /dev/ edit/dev
find what is still in the mounted fs and close it
a terminal or anything will hold a mount
a terminal or anything will hold a mount, mounted  i should say.
Okay. I'll close out my nautilus, gedit, and gnome-terminals.
if it's any consolation, i put linux on a bootable flash stick   but i don't recall ever using it sense then.
fuser
I'm just trying to make it so that I won't have to install all my apps whenever I reinstall. And for the learning experience.
yeah that last part was why i did.
anyway fuser can find what is holding it open.  and as i recall some times one may need to "losetup" the loop device to get a clean dismount of loopfs
ummm i'd say it is busy then...
sync and go for it.
gooday
